posts.content:
THE MAJORITY OF MESSAGES ARE FROM PEOPLE THAT WANT STRAIGHT GATES. THESE ARE NOT STRAIGHT AND I THINK TO BE IN STRIAGHT CONDITION IS UNLIKELY AFTER 40 YEARS.

I HAVE SEEN PANEL BEATERS DO WONDERS ON PANELS MUCH WORSE THAN THESE SO FOR A PROFESSIONAL THESE ARE VERY USEABLE. OR IF YOU WANT THAT ORIGINAL RAT LOOK THESE ARE IDEAL. I WILL GET SOMEONE TO VIEW THE GATES AND VALUE THEM.





The gates are average. No serious rust and very good metal and according to my panel beater with a bit of hard work they can be straightened. I wouldn't say they are candidates for that as new look but will improve to an acceptable standard. Depends how much time you want to spend on them. I understand they are pretty difficult to find in any condition so i would guess these are better than most a sthe truck is in very good condition too 40k klms from new.

Various loops have been welded on to secure a taupauline that would need to be removed if you didn't want them.

What are they worth ?

Hi,

I am interested in the rhs one for my SC, please could you send some more detailed pics to the e-mail address in my signature

where abouts are you based ?

All the Best ... Chris

rennsport classics wrote:

I understand they are pretty difficult to find in any condition so i would guess these are better than most a sthe truck is in very good condition too 40k klms from new.




Why would you want to sell them then?? Im not haveing a go at you, just was wondering what is going to hapen to that sweet truck?

Goodluck with the sale.

Eric.
